intro: Hoya narcissiflora, commonly known as the "star jasmine," is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its waxy, dark green leaves and clusters of star-shaped, fragrant white flowers. The plant is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions. Hoya narcissiflora produces its flowers in late winter to early spring, making it a popular choice for indoor gardens. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a sought-after houseplant.
